    • Uses of ReasonerStateException in org.semanticweb.vlog4j.core.reasoner

      Methods in org.semanticweb.vlog4j.core.reasoner that throw ReasonerStateException 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void Reasoner.addFacts​(@NonNull Collection<Atom> facts)
      Adds non-null facts to the reasoner knowledge base.
      void Reasoner.addFacts​(@NonNull Atom... facts)
      Adds non-null facts to the reasoner knowledge base.
      void Reasoner.addFactsFromDataSource​(@NonNull Predicate predicate, @NonNull DataSource dataSource)
      Adds facts stored in given dataSource for given predicate to the reasoner knowledge base.
      void Reasoner.addRules​(@NonNull List<Rule> rules)
      Adds rules to the reasoner knowledge base in the given order.
      void Reasoner.addRules​(@NonNull Rule... rules)
      Adds rules to the reasoner knowledge base in the given order.
      QueryResultIterator Reasoner.answerQuery​(@NonNull Atom queryAtom, boolean includeBlanks)
      Evaluates an atomic query (queryAtom) on the current state of the reasoner knowledge base: If the reasoner is loaded (see Reasoner.load()), but has not reasoned yet, the query will be evaluated on the explicit set of facts. Otherwise, if this method is called after reasoning (see Reasoner.reason(), the query will be evaluated on the explicit and implicit facts inferred trough reasoning.
      An answer to the query is the terms a fact that matches the quryAtom: the fact predicate is the same as the quryAtom predicate, the TermType.CONSTANT terms of the quryAtom appear in the answer fact at the same term position, and the TermType.VARIABLE terms of the quryAtom are matched by terms in the fact, either named (TermType.CONSTANT) or anonymous (TermType.BLANK).
      void Reasoner.exportQueryAnswersToCsv​(@NonNull Atom queryAtom, @NonNull String csvFilePath, boolean includeBlanks)
      Evaluates an atomic query (queryAtom) on the current state of the reasoner knowledge base, and writes its results the .csv file at given path csvFilePath: If the reasoner is loaded (see Reasoner.load()), but has not reasoned yet, the query will be evaluated on the explicit set of facts. Otherwise, if this method is called after reasoning (see Reasoner.reason(), the query will be evaluated on the explicit and implicit facts inferred trough reasoning.
      An answer to the query is the terms a fact that matches the quryAtom: the fact predicate is the same as the quryAtom predicate, the TermType.CONSTANT terms of the quryAtom appear in the answer fact at the same term position, and the TermType.VARIABLE terms of the quryAtom are matched by terms in the fact, either named (TermType.CONSTANT) or anonymous (TermType.BLANK).
      void Reasoner.load()
      Loads the knowledge base, consisting of the current rules and facts, into the reasoner (if it has not been loaded yet).
      boolean Reasoner.reason()
      Performs reasoning on the loaded knowledge base, depending on the set Algorithm.
      void Reasoner.resetReasoner()
      Resets the reasoner to a pre-loading state (before the call of Reasoner.load() method).
      void Reasoner.setLogFile​(@Nullable String filePath)
      Redirects the logs of the internal VLog C++ resource to given file.
      void Reasoner.setLogLevel​(@NonNull LogLevel logLevel)
      Sets the logging level of the internal VLog C++ resource.
      void Reasoner.setRuleRewriteStrategy​(@NonNull RuleRewriteStrategy ruleRewritingStrategy)
      Loaded Rules can be re-written internally to an equivalent set of rules, according to given ruleRewritingStrategy.
